Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) can efficiently generate continuous electricity for buildings but face technical and economic challenges to achieving mass market acceptance.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: We conducted a workshop comprising 23 experts to assess near-term markets, system cost and production scale, and system and stack degradation rates.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: Experts identified commercial- and residential-scale systems as the most favorable entry-level markets in the U.S. and world, respectively.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: The 2020, 2035, and 2050 median 250 kW electric-only system costs assessed by experts were $2,400/kW, $1,909/kW, and $841/kW (2018 USD) at production volumes of 210, 4000, and 10,000 systems per year, respectively.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: For small-scale combined heat and power applications, median 1 kW system cost assessments were $11,000/kW, $7,750/kW, and $5,750/kW at 50,000, 80,000 and 175,000 systems per year, respectively.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: Experts suggested voltage degradation could achieve 0.2%/1000 hrs in 2035-2050 and identified chromium poisoning, microstructural cathode degradation, and Ni agglomeration and coarsening as the most substantial barriers to mitigating degradation.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: To assess lifecycle performance, we incorporated experts' assessments into a cost of electricity (COE) model.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: The 250 kW system COE competed with anticipated internal combustion engine, microturbine, and U.S. grid COEs in 2035-2050.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: The 1 kW system COEs were three times anticipated grid prices in 2035-2050; however, 1 kW systems may be better suited to countries with higher spark spreads.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model

Sentencas: Our results could inform business decisions, funding prioritizations, and technology roadmap development.
Titulo: Paths to market for stationary solid oxide fuel cells: Expert elicitation and a cost of electricity model
